product_name: Hot ToolsProfessional 24K Gold One Step Volumizer and Hair Dryer
summary: SummaryGet simple, beautiful blowouts with one tool: the Hot Tools 24K Gold One Step Volumizer.
details: DetailsBenefitsGold Barrel surface is an unsurpassed heat conductor, distributing heat evenly from end to end so your hair is perfectly curledBoar Tech 2 Bristles complete with silk glide perfect the styling results with a silky-smooth finishCharcoal Infused Bristles for refreshing 2nd Day hair stylesFeaturesUnique Barrel Design for exceptional straightening and smooth volumeErgonomic Handle and Cool TipLightweight Design3 Heat/Speed Settings for drying and styling flexibilityDesigned with an ALCI Safety Plug8 ft Professional Swivel CordItem 2551629

reviews.headline: They must have updated the product - this one is trash!
reviews.comments: I've been a loyal buyer of this hairbrush since 2022 (bought 3 before buying this one). I loved the old version because it left my hair silky and smooth. This new one leaves it frizzy and dry! Don't buy!

reviews.headline: Soft Curls
reviews.comments: Tamed Curls

reviews.headline: Love this hair tool
reviews.comments: This is my second one. My first one just got damaged during a flight to Cozumel. Absolutely love this hair tooll

reviews.headline: I love it
reviews.comments: I have my brush for 3 years already still in really good condition and I will buy it again.

reviews.headline: Cord shorted out after 1.5 years
reviews.comments: I loved this dryer, but was so disappointed that only using 2-3 times a week and careful storing (and it being a swivel cord) the cord has a short in it only 1.5 years after I received it. I've had cheap dryers last longer.

reviews.headline: took practice, love it now
reviews.comments: i fried my hair at first. it gets super hot. NOW my routine is: wash hair, apply leave-in conditioner, air dry a bit, heat protectant, dry in sections, LOW setting only, take breaks, more heat protectant. takes me a while but it looks great.

reviews.headline: Wonderful results
reviews.comments: This is my 2nd one.  The other has not quit, but after abiout 4 years, I wanted to be sure I wasn't left without one.  Once I started using this dryer my hair was smoother, shinier and full where is should be.  ALSO, and the reason I bought a new dryer the first time, it did NOT catch my hair and pull it at the place where the two come together.  Best dryer I have owned in forever and forever is over 50 years.

reviews.headline: stopped getting hot after a year
reviews.comments: bought in July 2023 and died January 2025. so only lasted a little over a year and then just started only blowing cold air, no hot air. this is with cleaning the unit from hairs after each use, using it only once a week.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: Ive been using this for about 2 years now and absolutely love it!  I'm 29 and it gives my hair so much volume, which is definitely needed because I have very thin hair since due to having thyroid cancer and my thyroid being removed. I'm in love with this dryer and will keep buying it whenever this one dies'

reviews.headline: Pretty good
reviews.comments: Had for two years and now it only shoots out cold air.  Was good while it lasted.

reviews.headline: Broke in 10 months
reviews.comments: The brush was great when it was working. The last couple of months the bottom part would get super hot then one day it just stopped working.

reviews.headline: As good as a blowout from a salon!!
reviews.comments: I have CURLY hair and this gets it straught in like 30 mins!! It stays straught ans smooth for a week until I wash it. People are legit surprised I did it myself and didnt get a blow out. Best styling peoduct I have used!!

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: I had to return this one to get a smaller one. Too large for my hands to hold and style

reviews.headline: Ease of use, did not tangle
reviews.comments: Love it after 1 use

reviews.headline: Great product!
reviews.comments: I have been using this for 7 years now and i still absolutely love it! So convenient and quick to use to straighten my hair and add bounce before work every morning!

reviews.headline: I love my smooth hair!
reviews.comments: Way faster with much better results than using a dryer + brush! Much easier to get the unruly back of my head.

reviews.headline: Don't waste your money
reviews.comments: Junk. Stopped working after a month.

reviews.headline: Stopped working
reviews.comments: I had this  item for about one month and only used a few times. Already stopped working.

reviews.headline: Ruined my hair
reviews.comments: I had used this for about a year with no incident, when it decided to get extremely hot and singe the complete crown of my hair off to about 1 1/2 inches.

reviews.headline: Stopped working after a couple months
reviews.comments: It was working well but then it stopped heating up after 3-4 months

media.nickname: Mermaid hair to sleek and smooth

faceoff_positive.comments:
I have naturally thick, wavy hair and have always preferred to air dry over using a blow dryer. Every time I'd use a blow dryer, my hair would get so frizzy and fuzzy, no matter what heat protector I used. I've tried multiple times using different brushes and I'd always end up with the same results. I also should mention that I have weak muscles and problems with my nerves so standing for 30-45 minutes to fail at a blow out is nothing but a waste of time. I've been hearing about the hot air brushes from Revlon and John Frieda for over a year and have been wanting one so bad! So this year, I decided to buy myself one for my birthday!
Sadly, my local Ulta was sold out of the Revlon One-Step Volumizer and obviously didn't carry the John Frieda Volume Shine. I didn't want to wait to order either so I started looking at the Bed Head Blow Out Freak. It's the same price as the one by Revlon and seemed pretty similar. However, I felt unsure so I asked for help. I'm so glad I did, I was lead to the hot air brushes and was enthusiastically recommended either the Revlon or this one. As I said, they were sold out of the former, so I decided to get the latter. It was about $15 more, which kind of set me off from it. But with the "real talk" the sales woman had with me, she had me sold.
I LOVE this tool. I can easily and confidently create a smooth blow out with so pain or strain!
faceoff_positive.headline: Just W O W

faceoff_negative.comments:
I purchased this cautiously optimistic from the hundreds of reviews I read and online YouTube videos I watched.  I was hoping that this could be that magic tool to finally calm my wavy, frizzy hair.  This arrived today and here's my experience.  First my hair type is blonde, shoulder-length, frizzy and wavy and is colored every 8-12 weeks.  I used DreamCoat spray and Caviar blowout creme to help with the frizz and was hopeful this combination in addition to this styling dryer would give me the straight, frizz-free results so many others had.
I sectioned my hair and after a couple of minutes I noticed how unbelievably hot this dryer gets.  This dryer is more of an oval shape than the circular shape I expected.  I had this set on the highest setting to get the straight results I wanted.  This dryer has hot air blowing fiercely all over the barrel.  My bathroom is small and doesn't have windows and I had to have the door open and a fan on in addition to the air conditioning it became that hot.  The hot air blew against my face when drying the sides of my hair and it was uncomfortable.  I stopped partway through just to be able to cool down.  Also, this dryer is huge, almost too big.  My hair is shoulder length and this dryer felt too large for my hair.  It was difficult to get to the roots of my hair because this dryer was that large.  It is also very uncomfortable to hold for long period of time. I noticed when I set it down after a few minutes to answer a text, my hand was numb from holding it and it was difficult to move my fingers to text my daughter back.  That feeling eventually went away.  As a result, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who has hand or wrist issues.  It was also difficult for me to dry the back of my hair because this dryer was so large and I had trouble due to its size getting close enough to the roots in the back of my head and after I finished I realized there were parts still not dry.  I still had to go over my hair with my straightener.
faceoff_negative.headline: Honest Review - Didn't meet expectations
